page.title: 13Housing,Wick
page.content: In our area we have one typical croft which is still worked.It has a thatched roof,made by covering reeds with wire netting and weighting it down.The crofter is self sufficient in many ways as he grows his own crops and keeps hens,sheep and a cow.Many crofts have been modernised and use electricity unlike the paraffin lamps of the past.The remains of old crofts are very useful as sheep shelters. Around our school we have many council houses varying in size from two roomed for the elderly to five roomed for large families.There are also privately owned houses including detached,semi detached and bungalows.These houses vary in construction,some being wooden,others stone built.
